title: Voting guide: Here’s what voters need to know before Boston’s Tuesday election
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Boston polls open from 7 a.m. to 8 p.m. across 275 precincts for Tuesday's municipal election.
Mayor Michelle Wu is running unopposed; City Council races, including four at-large seats, are contested.
Ballots available in multiple languages, with in-person voting changes for Precinct 9 at West End Neighborhood Center.

title: The Bruins’ second line is looking like a difference-maker, in more ways than one
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Pavel Zacha, Casey Mittelstadt, and Viktor Arvidsson are driving the Bruins' second line's success.
Since being reinstated, Mittelstadt and Arvidsson have combined for five goals, aiding recent Bruins' victories.
Coach Marco Sturm's rotation strategy, including benching, has boosted player performance and team success.

title: Garrett Crochet, Roman Anthony named finalist for Cy Young, Rookie of the Year Awards
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Garrett Crochet named finalist for AL Cy Young, leading AL in innings pitched (205.1) and strikeouts (255).
Red Sox rookie Roman Anthony is a finalist for AL Rookie of the Year, with .292 average, eight home runs in 71 games.
Cy Young winner announced next Wednesday. Crochet competes with Detroit's Skubal, who led AL in ERA (2.21) and WHIP (0.89).

title: Ranking top priorities for Patriots at NFL trade deadline
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: The Patriots are considering trade options to address needs at running back and edge rusher before the NFL trade deadline.
New England is prioritizing strengthening their pass rush, with potential interest in players like Arden Key to improve defense.
Other team needs include adding depth in linebacker, safety, cornerback, and wide receiver positions due to injuries and thin rosters.

title: Patriots’ pass-protection issues are mounting as Drake Maye ties worrisome stat from last year
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: New England Patriots have allowed 34 sacks this season, second-most in the NFL, impacting quarterback Drake Maye.
Drake Maye has tied his previous season's sack total despite playing four fewer games, raising concerns.
Left side starts with rookies; offensive line allowing high pressures with Jared Wilson giving up 21 pressures.

title: Downtown Boston hotel settles discrimination complaint after woman was accused of being a man
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: Liberty Hotel settled a discrimination complaint for $10,000 after a woman was wrongly accused of being male.
Massachusetts Commission Against Discrimination claimed the couple was stereotyped, harassed, and retaliated against by the hotel.
The hotel will update policies, conduct anti-discrimination training, and post a non-discrimination statement in the lobby.

title: Falcons coach walks back ‘clapgate’ accusations after Patriots push back
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Falcons head coach Raheem Morris retracted accusations against the Patriots for simulating the snap count in their 24-23 loss.
Morris initially claimed the Patriots mimicked QB Michael Penix Jr.'s clapping, leading to a crucial intentional grounding penalty.
Patriots coach Mike Vrabel dismissed the claims, attributing any sound confusion to the crowd noise, denying any wrongdoing.

title: Alex Bregman opts out of Red Sox contract, will hit free agency
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Alex Bregman opts out of his Red Sox contract, entering free agency with two years and $80 million left.
Bregman hit .273 with 18 home runs and 62 RBIs in 114 games during the 2025 season with Boston.
The Red Sox will face competition from teams like the Tigers and Mariners to re-sign Bregman this offseason.

title: Patriots NFL trade deadline live updates: Will New England make moves before Tuesday?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Patriots considering roster upgrades as the NFL trade deadline approaches at 4 p.m. on Tuesday.
New England has expressed interest in Miami Dolphins WR Jaylen Waddle and Saints RB Alvin Kamara.
Patriots might trade OLB Anfernee Jennings, who hasn't started a game this season under new staff.

title: After an eventful week, Bruins’ Hampus Lindholm has ‘a lot to be thankful for’
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Hampus Lindholm and fiancée Amanda welcomed their first child, Magnolia, coinciding with his recent return from injury.
Lindholm's presence in the lineup correlates with Bruins' improved performance, going 5-1-0 with his contributions on defense.
Lindholm's return allows defensive strategy adjustments, pairing with Andrew Peeke, aiding Charlie McAvoy and Nikita Zadorov's top duo success.
